title: 113_s1515
content: The Act titled "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" allows for the conversion of Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to 401Kids Savings Accounts. The Act "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" allows for the conversion of Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to 401Kids Savings Accounts. Section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "Coverdell education savings account" with "401Kids savings account" in various subsections and headings. The Act "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to replace "Coverdell education savings account" with "401Kids savings account". The Act "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" replaces "Coverdell education savings account" with "401Kids savings account" in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" amends several sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by replacing "Coverdell education savings account" with "401Kids savings account". The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by replacing "Coverdell education savings accounts" with "401Kids savings accounts" and updating the heading of part VIII to "education and children's savings". Clerical amendments are also made to the table of parts for subchapter F. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" amends the Internal Revenue Code by replacing "Coverdell education savings accounts" with "401Kids savings accounts" under part VIII. Effective for taxable years after enactment, it also allows qualified distributions for first home purchases. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" replaces "Coverdell education savings accounts" with "401Kids savings accounts" in the Internal Revenue Code. It allows qualified distributions for first home purchases by amending section 530 of the Code to include "qualified expenses" such as first-time homebuyer expenses and education expenses. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" amends section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code to include qualified acquisition costs for first-time homebuyers as part of the definition of "qualified expenses." Additionally, there are conforming amendments made to other sections of the Code to align with these changes. The "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" expands the definition of "qualified expenses" in section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code to include qualified acquisition costs for first-time homebuyers. Conforming amendments are made to other sections of the Code to align with these changes. The amendments made by the "401Kids Family Savings Act of 2013" expand the definition of "qualified expenses" in section 530 of the Internal Revenue Code to include qualified acquisition costs for first-time homebuyers. These changes apply to distributions made in taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Qualified rollover contributions from 401Kids savings accounts to Roth IRAs. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows rollover contributions to Roth IRAs from eligible retirement plans and 401Kids savings accounts. The amendment allows rollover contributions to Roth IRAs from eligible retirement plans and 401Kids savings accounts, with specific requirements to be met. Qualified rollover contributions from individual retirement plans to a Roth IRA are disregarded. Effective for rollover contributions made in taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
